title: Problem Solving with Computers
description: Reinforcement of computer science fundamentals. Review of important algorithms, language features, design, syntax, and testing techniques. Repeated application of techniques to solve problems in a constrained amount of time. Primarily intended to support students preparing for the Association for Computing Machinery's International Collegiate Programming Contest. Credit/No Credit grading only. Total credit limited to 15 units. 1 laboratory. Crosslisted as CPE/CSCÂ 209.
prerequisites: CSC/CPE 101 or CSC/CPE 108 with a grade of C- or better, or consent of instructor
